CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 5,14,23 The lamellar d-spacing ( d 1 ) was 21.8 Å ( λ = 2d[sin θ ] ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| lamellar |
| d-spacing (d1) |
| 21.8 Å |
| λ |
| 2d |
| sin θ |

In this paragraph, the material names are "lamellar," "d-spacing (d1)," "21.8 Å," "λ," "2d," and "sin θ." These terms refer to specific physical or mathematical quantities related to the material being studied.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| lamellar |
| 21.8 Å |

In this paragraph, the only clear material name is "lamellar." The term "21.8 Å" is a unit of length used to describe the d-spacing, but it does not refer to a specific material itself.

In this paragraph, the "Property Value" entities are the measured d-spacing value of 21.8 Å and the expression λ = 2d[sin θ ]. These entities are mentioned as the lamellar d-spacing and the Bragg's Law equation, respectively.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 21.8 Å |

After reevaluating the paragraph, I found that only the measured d-spacing value of 21.8 Å can be considered a clear "Value of material property". The expression λ = 2d[sin θ ] represents a relationship between properties, rather than a specific value.
